meetup_0_organizer_bio:
We're #Resist Coordinators, here to empower you with more info, resources, and guidance to lead your local #Resist.

meetup_1_description: We believe it is within our right (and duty) to scrutinize the official investigation. However, the media, including public radio and television, do not encourage any scrutiny even though it is their job to do so. Why do they not want to engage in this conversation? It is a question we ask and wonder why so many citizens are unfamiliar with the third World Trade Center to collapse on September 11? If the media's job to is to inform, they have failed in this instance and are not interested in doing so now. Come share your thoughts, have a conversation with us, find out why we exercise our First Amendment right to ask relevant questions regarding the investigatory process surrounding the World Trade Center buildings. Soon it will be Veterans Day and what a better way to honor their service than to exercise your rights that they fought for you to have.
meetup_2_description:
a group of like minded people who love and want to protect animals from abuse, neglect, and harm.

all animals deserve to be loved and protected, not just companion animals. Farm animals, wildlife, endangered species, ocean life, etc. a place where people can speak openly and honestly, but without judgment, ridicule, or hostility! Vegans, vegetarians certainly welcome, but bring omnivores too!
meetup_3_description: This group is for people who are interested in guns. Whether you are a seasoned enthusiast, not yet an owner, carry permit holder or interested in becoming one, need advice or training, or just want to make friends, this Meetup is for you.
meetup_3_next_event_name: Regular Meetup
meetup_4_description: Let's get together and work to make a difference in each others lives, our community, and our country by forming personal friendships and alliances. We will lend our support to groups and causes that strive to improve the lives of women, immigrants, people of diverse backgrounds and ethnicities, the LGBTQIA community, impoverished people and all groups that may feel the political and all to real impact of these next four years. We will socialize together, and we will work for justice together.

meetup_0_description:
Austrian Economics is not the economics of the country of Austria, and you don't need to go to Austria to learn about it - in fact Austrian Economics is right here in St. Paul! Austrian Economics is about the economics of real people making economic decisions in the real world. It is called Austrian because many of the first Austrian economists, like Menger, Böhm-Bawerk, and Ludwig von Mises, were from Austria. But Austrian Economics is now taught and practiced all over the world. If you are not familiar with Austrian Economics or Ludwig von Mises, you can get a quick overview here (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_von_Mis...) and here (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austrian_schoo...). Please also check out the Ludwig von Mises Institute (http://mises.org/), which continues to carry on scholarship in the tradition of the Austrian School.

Our get-togethers are open to anyone interested in learning more about liberty, free markets, sound money and peace. Please join us!
meetup_0_name: The Pig's Eye Austrian Economics Meetup
meetup_0_next_event_name: A Mark, A Yen, A Buck, Or A Pound

meetup_0_description: This group is for citizens who are willing (or have) taken a second look into the attacks of September 11, 2001 and question the investigation procedure and conclusion. The group takes its lead from more than 2,300 professional architects and engineers who have called for an independent investigation. We meet to share this information from Architects and Engineers for 9/11 Truth to other citizens who are unaware of the third World Trade Center (#7) building to collapse that day. We encourage questions, open dialogue and support the standard practices for fire investigation using accepted procedures for scientific discovery.
meetup_0_next_event_name: Truth seeking

meetup_0_description: Are you are reeling from the recent election? Have you stopped listening to the media for fear that you will hear Trump’s voice? Or have you gone the other way and spent hours each day checking on what he has done, being outraged, and forwarding it on to others? Many people find they are now questioning their long-held beliefs about America, fellow citizens, and the future of our democracy. At this gathering Dr. Hunter will help you examine the psychological, emotional, and spiritual impact you have experienced from recent events, but more importantly, he will also help you identify what you can be done to recover from these negative effects, and to take meaningful action.
meetup_0_name: Post Trump Stress Disorder: Resilience In The Time Of Trump
meetup_0_organizer_bio: I love travel, discovery of most kinds, dancing, biking and hiking. I have 2 (adult) children & 3 grandchildren. I am a life coach.  I specialize in relationship, best-self, and life coaching.

meetup_0_description:
Sick of driving to Minneapolis to get your fix of Austrian Economics? The Green Anchor - Austrian Economics Meetup has expanded to the Southern-burbs!

The Green Anchor has been meeting every week on the south side of Minneapolis, Minnesota since 2007 to discuss and learn... more about economic freedom. The title of the group, The Green Anchor, was the name of the restaurant in Vienna where Ludwig von Mises gathered with his friends and students to discuss economics well into the late evening.

If you are not familiar with Austrian Economics or Ludwig von Mises, you can get a quick overview here (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_von_Mises) and here (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austrian_school).

Also, check out the Ludwig von Mises Institute (http://mises.org/), which continues to carry on scholarship in the tradition of the Austrian School. While we sometimes discuss local political and social issues that are of interest to our members, we generally choose a weekly topic relating to the free market. Our get-togethers are open to anyone interested in learning more about liberty, free markets, sound money and peace.

Please join us. To find out whether you are an Austrian, try this quiz! (http://mises.org/quiz.aspx)
meetup_0_name: Apple Valley Austrians - Green Anchor Too

meetup_0_description: The over-arching theme of this discussion group is the ideas and manifestations of human freedom. We will discuss historical periods and people who have been significant in the progression and protection of individual liberty, as well as those individuals and regimes who have tyrannized over mankind. This will require us to develop an understanding of the various ideologies which have made both Freedom-Fighters and Tyrants tick; and the means by which they enlightened and inspired or deluded and intimidated critical segments of the populous and thus shifted the course of history in the direction of a free, voluntary social order or a hegemonic order of masters and slaves. Come get acquainted, enjoy a beer or coffee while listening to a short discourse on a predefined topic, then engage in creative argumentation, chaotic discussion, provocative insinuation, or just do what thou wilt and let that be the whole of the law.
meetup_0_name: Free Radicals - Theory and History of Freedom

Welcome, we're glad you're joining/considering joining us! This is a book club for feminist folks, all genders welcome. We will be reading non-fiction, fiction, and memoirs either by self-identified feminists or by anyone critical of gender oppression (and however this intersects with other types of prejudice and discrimination).
meetup_0_next_event_name: April Book Club - We Were Feminists Once by Andi Zeisler
meetup_1_description:
Welcome to MN NORML's Meetup group!

MN NORML is a member based, nonprofit 501(c)4 organization, incorporated in Minnesota.  We are the statewide affiliate of The National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws (NORML.)  You can find detailed information about us and become a member of MN NORML on our website: http://www.mnNORML.org

Mission Statement

To repeal Minnesota's cannabis prohibition laws

so that responsible use of cannabis by adults

is no longer subject to penalty.

You can also find us at:

Google Groups: http://groups.google.com/group/mnNORML

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/mnNORML/

Twitter: http://twitter.com/mnNORML
meetup_2_description:
The Green Anchor has been meeting every week on the south side of Minneapolis, Minnesota since 2007 to discuss and learn more about economic freedom. The title of our group, The Green Anchor, was the name of the restaurant in Vienna where Ludwig von Mises gathered with his friends to discuss economics well into the late evening. If you are not familiar with Austrian Economics or Ludwig von Mises, you can get a quick overview here (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_von_Mises) and here (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austrian_school). Please also check out the Ludwig von Mises Institute (http://mises.org/), which continues to carry on scholarship in the tradition of the Austrian School.

While we generally choose a weekly topic relating to the market, we also discuss practical issues revolving around individual and small group "economizing" in an increasingly uncertain world.

Our meetups are open to anyone interested in learning more about liberty, free markets, sound money and peace. Please join us.
meetup_2_name: The Green Anchor - An Austrian Economics Meetup

meetup_6_description:
People who are aware of the systematic abuse in LE, the courts, and in prisons and people who want to discuss economic violence. Topics will include the 13th amendment, legalizing marijuana, creating internet spaces for civil rights activism, how wealth supremacy feeds white supremacy, why income inequality is violence, and more.
This group is for networking and sharing resources and information on local community activism. One goal is to also network with national activists.
meetup_7_description: #iLegislate is an initiative of Take Back Your State that brings people together to discuss and take action on State Legislation. iLegislate meetups are non-partisan and welcome people from all backgrounds/beliefs to engage in discussion. When it comes down to reviewing individual pieces of legislation and evaluating our elected officials based on their actual work, we’ll find that we are all more similar than different.
meetup_8_description: All who support the principles of reform in our local, state and federal governments. Reform is about finding and acting on policies that improve the condition of our people, our ideas, and our society...it's about making change.
meetup_8_organizer_bio:
I like playing at the Y but want to put more time in. 

Peter T.
meetup_9_description:
Welcome to the Minnesota Chapter of Americans United for Separation of Church & State. See the main website here: http://www.au.org/

The MN Chapter of AU is a nonpartisan organization dedicated to preserving church-state separation to ensure religious freedom for ALL Americans.
meetup_9_name: MN Chapter Americans United for Separation of Church & State
meetup_9_organizer_bio: Just a freethinker who likes to get together with others who are like-minded.

People who are aware of the systematic abuse in LE, the courts, and in prisons and people who want to discuss economic violence. Topics will include the 13th amendment, legalizing marijuana, creating internet spaces for civil rights activism, how wealth supremacy feeds white supremacy, why income inequality is violence, and more.
This group is for networking and sharing resources and information on local community activism. One goal is to also network with national activists.

When it comes down to reviewing individual pieces of legislation and evaluating our elected officials based on their actual work, we’ll find that we are all more similar than different.

meetup_1_description:
Welcome to MN NORML's Meetup group!

MN NORML is a member based, nonprofit 501(c)4 organization, incorporated in Minnesota.  We are the statewide affiliate of The National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws (NORML.)  You can find detailed information about us and become a member of MN NORML on our website: http://www.mnNORML.org

Mission Statement

To repeal Minnesota's cannabis prohibition laws

so that responsible use of cannabis by adults

is no longer subject to penalty.

You can also find us at:

Google Groups: http://groups.google.com/group/mnNORML

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/mnNORML/

Twitter: http://twitter.com/mnNORML
meetup_2_description:
The Green Anchor has been meeting every week on the south side of Minneapolis, Minnesota since 2007 to discuss and learn more about economic freedom. The title of our group, The Green Anchor, was the name of the restaurant in Vienna where Ludwig von Mises gathered with his friends to discuss economics well into the late evening. If you are not familiar with Austrian Economics or Ludwig von Mises, you can get a quick overview here (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_von_Mises) and here (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austrian_school). Please also check out the Ludwig von Mises Institute (http://mises.org/), which continues to carry on scholarship in the tradition of the Austrian School.

While we generally choose a weekly topic relating to the market, we also discuss practical issues revolving around individual and small group "economizing" in an increasingly uncertain world.

Our meetups are open to anyone interested in learning more about liberty, free markets, sound money and peace. Please join us.
meetup_2_name: The Green Anchor - An Austrian Economics Meetup
meetup_3_description:
Concerned about where the country is heading? You're not alone. Join others who care about what's happening to democracy, equality, human rights, social justice, sustainability, and other important topics. It's ok if you've never been to a protest, march, or town hall -- start here. You really can make a difference.

WHAT YOU CAN DO

meetup_0_description: It's a hard job but I have decided to do it. This group will be a safe and neutral meeting ground for all varieties of self-identified socialists. Ideally it should be a place where people can leave their labels and their (intellectual) guns at the door. Talk of the future not the past. Share what we agree on and be respectful about what we don't.

PALLS is a group of progressively minded people working to improve our country through political action, education, or just good friendships. You decide what level of interest and commitment you will bring to the group. You can just socialize with people who share your values, or get more involved. Whether it be writing letters, calling Members of Congress, marching to the capitol, joining town halls (even empty chair events!) or just sharing a festive dinner with like minded friends, we create opportunities for progressives to meet, socialize and participate. PALLS organizes educational events and posts actions from other groups of interest to our members. We meet for coffee periodically and host Sunday brunches the third Sunday of each month.

If you want to organize an event or cross list progressive activities, we will help you. We welcome and encourage new members to bring their ideas for events and activities to our group. Democracy takes work and it is involves all of us working together. Host a coffee chat. Organize an discussion group. Invite activists to tell us about their work. Plan a happy hour or an informal lunch or dinner. If you lean even a little bit toward the left, you will find friends here.
meetup_0_name: PALLS - Politically Aware Left Leaners Socializing

meetup_0_description:
Have you heard of Ayn Rand and wondered why she's so popular? Why her books are still selling in the millions each year? 61 years after Atlas Shrugged was published (her most acclaimed novel), it still sells hundreds of thousands of copies each year! 

  Have you read Atlas Shrugged? The Fountainhead? Do you enjoy philosophy? Then join us at the U of MN campus - Minneapolis. We meet for philosophy, discussion, reading, and videos - all about Rand and her philosophy, Objectivism. 

  You don't have to be a U of MN student and you don't have to know anything about her or her philosophy.  Just bring an appetite for learning and a genuine interest in knowing more about her... We'll be meeting at at the Carlson School of Management on the West Bank - time and date TBA. Stay tuned for more announcements!
meetup_0_name: Ayn Rand Study Group - U of MN Meetup (open to public)

meetup_1_description:
Welcome to MN NORML's Meetup group!

MN NORML is a member based, nonprofit 501(c)4 organization, incorporated in Minnesota.  We are the statewide affiliate of The National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws (NORML.)  You can find detailed information about us and become a member of MN NORML on our website: http://www.mnNORML.org

Mission Statement

To repeal Minnesota's cannabis prohibition laws

so that responsible use of cannabis by adults

is no longer subject to penalty.

You can also find us at:

Google Groups: http://groups.google.com/group/mnNORML

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/mnNORML/

Twitter: http://twitter.com/mnNORML
meetup_2_description:
The Green Anchor has been meeting every week on the south side of Minneapolis, Minnesota since 2007 to discuss and learn more about economic freedom. The title of our group, The Green Anchor, was the name of the restaurant in Vienna where Ludwig von Mises gathered with his friends to discuss economics well into the late evening. If you are not familiar with Austrian Economics or Ludwig von Mises, you can get a quick overview here (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_von_Mises) and here (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austrian_school). Please also check out the Ludwig von Mises Institute (http://mises.org/), which continues to carry on scholarship in the tradition of the Austrian School.

While we generally choose a weekly topic relating to the market, we also discuss practical issues revolving around individual and small group "economizing" in an increasingly uncertain world.

Our meetups are open to anyone interested in learning more about liberty, free markets, sound money and peace. Please join us.
meetup_2_name: The Green Anchor - An Austrian Economics Meetup

meetup_6_description:
People who are aware of the systematic abuse in LE, the courts, and in prisons and people who want to discuss economic violence. Topics will include the 13th amendment, legalizing marijuana, creating internet spaces for civil rights activism, how wealth supremacy feeds white supremacy, why income inequality is violence, and more.
This group is for networking and sharing resources and information on local community activism. One goal is to also network with national activists.
meetup_7_description: #iLegislate is an initiative of Take Back Your State that brings people together to discuss and take action on State Legislation. iLegislate meetups are non-partisan and welcome people from all backgrounds/beliefs to engage in discussion. When it comes down to reviewing individual pieces of legislation and evaluating our elected officials based on their actual work, we’ll find that we are all more similar than different.
meetup_8_description: All who support the principles of reform in our local, state and federal governments. Reform is about finding and acting on policies that improve the condition of our people, our ideas, and our society...it's about making change.

#Resist brings people together to act in their neighborhoods on the values essential to democracy. We show up, and keep showing up.
meetup_6_description:
People who are aware of the systematic abuse in LE, the courts, and in prisons and people who want to discuss economic violence. Topics will include the 13th amendment, legalizing marijuana, creating internet spaces for civil rights activism, how wealth supremacy feeds white supremacy, why income inequality is violence, and more.
This group is for networking and sharing resources and information on local community activism. One goal is to also network with national activists.
meetup_7_description: #iLegislate is an initiative of Take Back Your State that brings people together to discuss and take action on State Legislation. iLegislate meetups are non-partisan and welcome people from all backgrounds/beliefs to engage in discussion. When it comes down to reviewing individual pieces of legislation and evaluating our elected officials based on their actual work, we’ll find that we are all more similar than different.
meetup_8_description: All who support the principles of reform in our local, state and federal governments. Reform is about finding and acting on policies that improve the condition of our people, our ideas, and our society...it's about making change.
meetup_8_organizer_bio:
I like playing at the Y but want to put more time in. 

Peter T.
meetup_9_description:
Welcome to the Minnesota Chapter of Americans United for Separation of Church & State. See the main website here: http://www.au.org/

The MN Chapter of AU is a nonpartisan organization dedicated to preserving church-state separation to ensure religious freedom for ALL Americans.
meetup_9_name: MN Chapter Americans United for Separation of Church & State
meetup_9_organizer_bio: Just a freethinker who likes to get together with others who are like-minded.

meetup_0_description: Welcome, we're glad you're joining/considering joining us! This is a book club for feminist folks, all genders welcome. We will be reading non-fiction, fiction, and memoirs either by self-identified feminists or by anyone critical of gender oppression (and however this intersects with other types of prejudice and discrimination).
meetup_0_next_event_name: April Book Club - We Were Feminists Once by Andi Zeisler
meetup_1_description:
Welcome to MN NORML's Meetup group!

MN NORML is a member based, nonprofit 501(c)4 organization, incorporated in Minnesota.  We are the statewide affiliate of The National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws (NORML.)  You can find detailed information about us and become a member of MN NORML on our website: http://www.mnNORML.org

Mission Statement

To repeal Minnesota's cannabis prohibition laws

so that responsible use of cannabis by adults

is no longer subject to penalty.

You can also find us at:

Google Groups: http://groups.google.com/group/mnNORML

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/mnNORML/

Twitter: http://twitter.com/mnNORML
meetup_2_description:
The Green Anchor has been meeting every week on the south side of Minneapolis, Minnesota since 2007 to discuss and learn more about economic freedom. The title of our group, The Green Anchor, was the name of the restaurant in Vienna where Ludwig von Mises gathered with his friends to discuss economics well into the late evening. If you are not familiar with Austrian Economics or Ludwig von Mises, you can get a quick overview here (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_von_Mises) and here (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austrian_school). Please also check out the Ludwig von Mises Institute (http://mises.org/), which continues to carry on scholarship in the tradition of the Austrian School.

While we generally choose a weekly topic relating to the market, we also discuss practical issues revolving around individual and small group "economizing" in an increasingly uncertain world.

Our meetups are open to anyone interested in learning more about liberty, free markets, sound money and peace. Please join us.
meetup_2_name: The Green Anchor - An Austrian Economics Meetup
meetup_3_description:
Concerned about where the country is heading? You're not alone. Join others who care about what's happening to democracy, equality, human rights, social justice, sustainability, and other important topics. It's ok if you've never been to a protest, march, or town hall -- start here. You really can make a difference.

WHAT YOU CAN DO
- Join this group now
- Schedule one of our Meetup ideas in your neighborhood
- Discuss your own Meetup ideas in the group conversation

OUR COMMUNITY GUIDELINES
- Be Peaceful
- Be Safe
- Be Kind
- Be Respectful
- Be Real

Share your American Story! What can we learn from each other?

A Safe place to discuss your reactions to the Trump presidency.

All people who stand for Human Rights, Diversity, Equality, Economic Justice and Peace in this world!

Join others who care about what's happening to democracy, equality, human rights, social justice, sustainability, and other important topics. It's ok if you've never been to a protest, march, or town hall -- start here. You really can make a difference.

WHAT YOU CAN DO
- Join this group now
- Schedule one of our Meetup ideas in your neighborhood
- Discuss your own Meetup ideas in the group conversation

OUR COMMUNITY GUIDELINES
- Be Peaceful
- Be Safe
- Be Kind
- Be Respectful
- Be Real
meetup_3_next_event_name: SUPREME COURT TO RULE ON GERRYMANDERING; Act Now
meetup_3_organizer_bio:
We're #Resist Coordinators, here to empower you with more info, resources, and guidance to lead your local #Resist.

#Resist brings people together to act in their neighborhoods on the values essential to democracy. We show up, and keep showing up.
meetup_4_description: This group is for people interested in furthering the development of worker cooperatives/worker self-directed enterprises in the Twin Cities area. All those who wish to develop businesses along a non-hierarchical, democratic model are welcome to attend.
meetup_5_description:
Share your American Story! What can we learn from each other?

A Safe place to discuss your reactions to the Trump presidency.

All people who stand for Human Rights, Diversity, Equality, Economic Justice and Peace in this world!
meetup_5_organizer_bio:
We're #Resist Coordinators, here to empower you with more info, resources, and guidance to lead your local #Resist.

#Resist brings people together to act in their neighborhoods on the values essential to democracy. We show up, and keep showing up.
meetup_6_description:
People who are aware of the systematic abuse in LE, the courts, and in prisons and people who want to discuss economic violence. Topics will include the 13th amendment, legalizing marijuana, creating internet spaces for civil rights activism, how wealth supremacy feeds white supremacy, why income inequality is violence, and more.
This group is for networking and sharing resources and information on local community activism. One goal is to also network with national activists.
meetup_7_description: #iLegislate is an initiative of Take Back Your State that brings people together to discuss and take action on State Legislation. iLegislate meetups are non-partisan and welcome people from all backgrounds/beliefs to engage in discussion. When it comes down to reviewing individual pieces of legislation and evaluating our elected officials based on their actual work, we’ll find that we are all more similar than different.
meetup_8_description: All who support the principles of reform in our local, state and federal governments. Reform is about finding and acting on policies that improve the condition of our people, our ideas, and our society...it's about making change.
meetup_8_organizer_bio:
I like playing at the Y but want to put more time in. 

Peter T.
meetup_9_description:
Welcome to the Minnesota Chapter of Americans United for Separation of Church & State. See the main website here: http://www.au.org/

The MN Chapter of AU is a nonpartisan organization dedicated to preserving church-state separation to ensure religious freedom for ALL Americans.
meetup_9_name: MN Chapter Americans United for Separation of Church & State
meetup_9_organizer_bio: Just a freethinker who likes to get together with others who are like-minded.

meetup_0_description: Welcome, we're glad you're joining/considering joining us! This is a book club for feminist folks, all genders welcome. We will be reading non-fiction, fiction, and memoirs either by self-identified feminists or by anyone critical of gender oppression (and however this intersects with other types of prejudice and discrimination).
meetup_0_next_event_name: April Book Club - We Were Feminists Once by Andi Zeisler
meetup_1_description:
Welcome to MN NORML's Meetup group!

MN NORML is a member based, nonprofit 501(c)4 organization, incorporated in Minnesota.  We are the statewide affiliate of The National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws (NORML.)  You can find detailed information about us and become a member of MN NORML on our website: http://www.mnNORML.org

Mission Statement

To repeal Minnesota's cannabis prohibition laws

so that responsible use of cannabis by adults

is no longer subject to penalty.

You can also find us at:

Google Groups: http://groups.google.com/group/mnNORML

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/mnNORML/

Twitter: http://twitter.com/mnNORML
meetup_2_description:
The Green Anchor has been meeting every week on the south side of Minneapolis, Minnesota since 2007 to discuss and learn more about economic freedom. The title of our group, The Green Anchor, was the name of the restaurant in Vienna where Ludwig von Mises gathered with his friends to discuss economics well into the late evening. If you are not familiar with Austrian Economics or Ludwig von Mises, you can get a quick overview here (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_von_Mises) and here (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austrian_school). Please also check out the Ludwig von Mises Institute (http://mises.org/), which continues to carry on scholarship in the tradition of the Austrian School.

While we generally choose a weekly topic relating to the market, we also discuss practical issues revolving around individual and small group "economizing" in an increasingly uncertain world.

Our meetups are open to anyone interested in learning more about liberty, free markets, sound money and peace. Please join us.
meetup_2_name: The Green Anchor - An Austrian Economics Meetup

meetup_0_name: National Organization for Women - DC Chapter
meetup_0_next_event_name: DC NOW - Chapter Meeting
meetup_1_description: Interested in the Libertarian movement in the District of Columbia? If you're a resident of Washington, DC who believes in lower taxes, smaller government join us and learn about our constant activities.
meetup_1_next_event_name: Startup Societies
meetup_2_description: This Meetup will be a community for Conservative minded women in the Washington, D.C. area.
meetup_2_organizer_bio: Chicago native • world traveler • runner • language enthusiast • adventure seeker
meetup_3_description: Calling all secular activists close to the DC/MD/VA area! This is a group where volunteers, activists and secular-minded people can join and be involved in the Secular Coalition for America's local outreach, political advocacy and lobbying efforts. Joining this group will give you access to SCA staff, lobby training, and up to date, insider information on our upcoming events.
meetup_4_description: We are a group of Washington DC Democrats who are interested in everything DC, DC residents, DC Democrats and DC issues.
meetup_5_description:
This is a group dedicated to the establishment of a $15/hr minimum wage in Washington DC, and eventually across the nation. Our goal is to empower working people and activate them into a fighting movement. We aim to build a network of activists in the nation's capitol to achieve our goal. If you are interested in joining a grassroots campaign to increase the minimum wage in Washington DC to $15/hr  then join us!

Visit 15now.org for more information!
meetup_6_description:
Startup Policy Lab brings public policy directly to the startup community and empowers individuals to participate and engage. Our events focus on education and to gather people together that are interested in discussing, sharing, educating, and building a community around policy issues critical to startups and early stage companies. Check out our newsletter it's kinda funny, we think you'll like it.

Website: Startup Policy Lab

Check out our SF Chapter: Startup Policy Lab SF

Check out our NYC Chapter: Startup Policy Lab NYC
meetup_6_organizer_bio: I am the Executive Director of Startup Policy Lab, a nonprofit a nonprofit think tank working at the intersection of technology, and policy that builds technology to inform data driven public policy.
meetup_7_description: The Open Data Leaders Meetup features federal, state, and local government leaders presenting on recent open data initiatives. Each event will bring in experts from a single agency to discuss a recent project and share the challenges and solutions they have discovered through their efforts. The goal of these events is to foster an open conversation between data providers, civic technologists, businesses, and government agencies. Participants will have an opportunity to learn about new open data projects, share feedback with government agencies, and offer design and outreach tips to improve relations between government agencies and the organizations that use their data. By bringing the open data community together, Open Data Leaders hopes to harmonize public and private sector efforts around open data to promote innovation, improve government services, and foster transparency.
meetup_7_organizer_bio: I'm the director of the Center for Data Innovation, a Washington, DC-based non-profit think tank working at the intersection of data, technology, and public policy.
meetup_8_description: The DC Conservative Meetup welcomes people of all ages who are interested in learning more about American Conservatism. So, if you are a dyed-in-the-wool Republican, consider yourself to be a serious Libertarian or are just interested in learning more about politics and political ideas, please join us. We meet for a variety of activities including book and current event discussions. So, come out for an hour or two, meet new people and challenge your thinking! We meet at Metro accessible coffee shops or other locations, so you can have a sandwitch or a snack.
meetup_8_organizer_bio: Jennifer Schauss has 20 yrs experience with B2G contracts - selling & navigating the federal markets (GSA Schedules) on behalf of domestic & foreign companies, large & small businesses.   http://www.JenniferSchaus.com  Washington, DC

meetup_6_organizer_bio: I am the Executive Director of Startup Policy Lab, a nonprofit a nonprofit think tank working at the intersection of technology, and policy that builds technology to inform data driven public policy.
meetup_7_description: The Open Data Leaders Meetup features federal, state, and local government leaders presenting on recent open data initiatives. Each event will bring in experts from a single agency to discuss a recent project and share the challenges and solutions they have discovered through their efforts. The goal of these events is to foster an open conversation between data providers, civic technologists, businesses, and government agencies. Participants will have an opportunity to learn about new open data projects, share feedback with government agencies, and offer design and outreach tips to improve relations between government agencies and the organizations that use their data. By bringing the open data community together, Open Data Leaders hopes to harmonize public and private sector efforts around open data to promote innovation, improve government services, and foster transparency.
meetup_7_organizer_bio: I'm the director of the Center for Data Innovation, a Washington, DC-based non-profit think tank working at the intersection of data, technology, and public policy.
meetup_8_description: The DC Conservative Meetup welcomes people of all ages who are interested in learning more about American Conservatism. So, if you are a dyed-in-the-wool Republican, consider yourself to be a serious Libertarian or are just interested in learning more about politics and political ideas, please join us. We meet for a variety of activities including book and current event discussions. So, come out for an hour or two, meet new people and challenge your thinking! We meet at Metro accessible coffee shops or other locations, so you can have a sandwitch or a snack.
meetup_8_organizer_bio: Jennifer Schauss has 20 yrs experience with B2G contracts - selling & navigating the federal markets (GSA Schedules) on behalf of domestic & foreign companies, large & small businesses.   http://www.JenniferSchaus.com  Washington, DC

(Only a small number of our members are organized via meet up.)

meetup_3_description: Calling all secular activists close to the DC/MD/VA area! This is a group where volunteers, activists and secular-minded people can join and be involved in the Secular Coalition for America's local outreach, political advocacy and lobbying efforts. Joining this group will give you access to SCA staff, lobby training, and up to date, insider information on our upcoming events.
meetup_4_description: We are a group of Washington DC Democrats who are interested in everything DC, DC residents, DC Democrats and DC issues.
meetup_5_description:
This is a group dedicated to the establishment of a $15/hr minimum wage in Washington DC, and eventually across the nation. Our goal is to empower working people and activate them into a fighting movement. We aim to build a network of activists in the nation's capitol to achieve our goal. If you are interested in joining a grassroots campaign to increase the minimum wage in Washington DC to $15/hr  then join us!

Visit 15now.org for more information!

Check out our newsletter it's kinda funny, we think you'll like it.

meetup_1_description:
We are organizing to put an initiative on the 2018 general election ballot that will implement campaign finance reforms. We will also lobby Helena to see if the two major political parties in the legislature will step up to campaign finance reform without an initiative.

You should join us:
- if you are concerned about the future of politics in Montana,
- if you would like to reduce the impact of money on the political process in Montana, and
- if you are willing to support public financing of campaigns and information systems.

meetup_0_description:
Interested parties will consist of those called to the 'plight of the homeless." Pennies From Heaven is a Non-Profit organization that has networked to provide for the homeless community in the St. Louis City and County areas since 1998.

Our newest campaign is to create jobs for homeless men and women with families or those with the desire to become employed to create a better life; as they learn of a better way of life. Pennies From Heaven needs committed people called to make a difference in the life of the homeless, whom are able to visualize "Wholeness for the Homeless".

Coming together to support and supply ideas to develop the employment piece to the vision is the mission for any and all fundraising efforts by "Pennies From Heaven Fundraising Meetups".  It is our desire for each member to get on board with existing ideas as well as be willing to incorporate new ones to promote a well rounded, piloted program for vocational growth for the homeless. 

Please make sure you RSVP for all up coming Meetups -- I look forward to meeting each member and share ideas with you.  We have a fundraisers we are preparing for and need the man power of those who feel the burden of this call to take part.

Thank you and God Bless you!

Marcia Baker  
marcia.marciab.baker5@gmail.com
meetup_1_description: Calling all disability advocates! Whether you are someone directly affected by a disability, a family member, friend, or any other type of supporter, we would love to get to know you. Our group exists to help us help each other in any way we can. We have many different types of activities so please stop by and let us get to know each other and visit our new website to learn more!

meetup_0_description:
Here is your chance to move the water cooler at work out amongst the rest of the world. This multi-partisan group will talk about everything from politics to religion to race; the things that you aren't supposed to talk about in public. 

We are about the sharing of ideas and points of view. Points of view which will likely be different from views you currently hold. The goal is not to solve anything, but to leave the Meetup with a better understanding of how someone who hold beliefs completely opposite from you can come to their conclusions. This requires disagreement, but respect for other people and the acknowledgement that they are completely entitled to the views they hold. 

So bring your brain and your passion, but leave your anger and condescension at home. It is encouraged that we all leave as friends, but required that we don't leave as enemies. For this group to succeed, it is important that we have a diverse group of people from conservatives to liberals; from believers to non believers, etc. We need different nationalities, ethnicities and religions that come from all walks of life.

Caution: If you are a hothead, this is not the group for you. You won't enjoy the Meetup and neither will we. Besides, there are plenty of what I call "Lovefest groups" out there that are willing support your already held beliefs. This is a "Learnfest!" So come test your views on politics, heaven and hell, the best positions for making love, affirmative action, etc...what you learn should and could be fun!
meetup_0_name: The Issues You Don't Talk About Cafe
meetup_0_next_event_name: The Issues You Don't Talk About Cafe Mid-Month Meetup
meetup_0_organizer_bio: One of the fondest memories of my high school youth was drama class.  I don't remember doing much drama, but we did do a lot of improvisation and games.  I'd like to revisit those days to see where it goes.  Maybe a new acting company will be born.
meetup_1_description: This is a group for anyone who wants to really understand if their is any truth to "Conspiracy Theories, UFO phenomena, Government cover ups, Globalist Agenda, Chem Trails...etc... etc..." If you watch or listen to David Wilcox, Corey Goode, Gaia TV, Ancient Aliens, Alex Jones, David Ike, Believe Snowden and Julian Assange are Hero's. Wiki Leaks are important and true and also believe we need to have full DISCLOSURE. This is a group to make friends, socialize and share information without being looked at like you are crazy! A safe place where you can talk with others who are awake. To get a glimpse of what we are about watch the movie "Thrive" on Utube.

meetup_3_next_event_name: Townhall Meetup
meetup_4_description: This is a group to help fellow conservatives grow their businesses through professional networking and fellowship. Meetings will be focused on building a network of like minded referral partners who through the growing of their businesses together help to make each other prosperous. Presenters may include not only our members, but individuals who address issues of importance to our belief in the free market and our professional development.
meetup_5_description:
St. Louis Indivisible is one of several local activist groups following the methods of resistance laid out in the Indivisible Guide.

 Indivisible is a very specific, highly effective action plan written by congressional staffers. The plan is based on the methods the Tea Party used to obstruct Obama for eight years. Our local Indivisible groups are part of a network of groups across the country that are pressuring their Members of Congress to resist the current agenda, and what we're doing works. Come join us!

This Meetup group shares events scheduled by St. Louis Indivisible. If you're on Facebook, you can join them directly below. 

St. Louis Indivisible: A Political Action Salon
meetup_5_organizer_bio: I'm a freelance writer, and I've been living out of a backpack for almost 3 years. I'll be returning to St. Louis in March, and I'm really excited about making a life there, so I'm starting to join groups in advance. Look forward to joining you!
meetup_6_description:
The American Solidarity Party is committed to transcending the Red/Blue divide with coherent policies informed by religious values. We offer the following program for a future based on the principles of Common Good, Common Ground, and Common Sense.

- Right to Life
- Religion in the Public Square
- Civil Rights
- Economic Participation
- Banking & Finance in the Public Interest
- Free and Fair Trade
- Stewardship of the Environment
- Civic Engagement
- Public Services
- Justice in the Workplace
- National Security
meetup_7_description: Dennis Prager talk radio listeners gather monthly with other conservatives for an evening of lively discussion and camaraderie.  Dennis is a conservative talk radio host and columnist for Townhall.com.
meetup_7_name: The Missouri Dennis Prager Meetup Group
meetup_8_description:
This site offers factual information and viewpoints that might be useful in arriving at an understanding of the events of our time. We believe that the information comes from reliable sources, but cannot guarantee the information to be free of mistakes and incorrect interpretations. 

Please be sure to enable the site to send you emails.

To see unobstructed tiles, click on Sponsors and scroll down.

Introductory Video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8HZdgaViIyI.

Theme songs: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hvQOA0fznrA  (The Visitors).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jDJpf2mQ0w4  (Faster).

We are residents of the Greater St. Louis Area (and other areas throughout the world) concerned about the many disturbing aspects of the 9/11 attacks and interested in finding out more about those events. We share the St. Louis Fusion Center's dedication to ". . . the collection, analysis and dissemination of information used to detect, defend against, or respond to acts of terrorism." We have many disagreements, but we agree that 9/11 is worth inquiring into. We are inclusive as opposed to exclusive. Generally, we believe that when an object moves under the influence of gravity, the object goes down, not upwards and outwards in an arc, as objects did when the Towers "fell."

James Ridgeway says:

". . . not one person in the White House—or in the cabinet, or the Pentagon, or anywhere in the Bush administration—was fired because of failure to perform on 9/11. Not one person resigned. With the exception of Richard Clarke, not one person apologized to the victims' families. Nearly twenty-eight hundred people died, and not one of the people responsible for protecting them was held accountable." (The Five Unanswered Questions about 9/11, p. 88.)

And, several were handsomely rewarded.


Regarding the murder of the Russian journalist Anna Politkovskaya, who was critical of Vladimir Putin, Reporters Without Borders states:

"Novaya Gazeta editor Dmitry Muratov said there was still a 'political taboo' about the real mastermind’s identity. 'Six years have gone by – it is time to ask difficult questions,' he said."

Fifteen years have gone by since September 11, 2001. Here in the United States, we too say: "It is time to ask difficult questions."

ATTEMPTS TO DISCOURAGE INQUIRY

(If you have not read Ibsen's play An Enemy of the People, it is available here: http://www2.hn.psu.edu/faculty/jmanis/h-ibs...  .)

We are aware that the bulk of the mass media are owned by at most six international conglomerates, and that they are united in their efforts to portray any inquiry into the events of 9/11 as somehow harmful or hurtful to the families of the victims of that catastrophe. But it was precisely a group of widowed mothers who first raised questions, and who pressured the government into conducting any investigation whatsoever. In the words of one of them, Patty Casazza, "Likeminded, we all had questions. We all had questions, and we wanted answers."  Their struggle to obtain information from the government is documented in the video 9/11: Press for Truth, at: http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=397... .

Seventy percent of their questions went unanswered by the 9/11 Commission, and are unanswered still.

Survivors have sued for the loss of their loved ones, and not one family member's case has been allowed to go to trial, where rules of evidence would permit questioning in public and under oath, and deponents can be compelled to answer. Widowed 9/11 family member Ellen Mariani  has challenged the official story in the U.S. court system for over a decade; repeated dismissals forced her to appeal unsuccessfully for a hearing by the U.S. Supreme Court. See: http://marianilawsuit.wordpress.com/ .

We are guided by Donna Marsh O'Connor, who lost her pregnant daughter on 9/11.  Her feelings may be seen at: http://www.videorolls.com/watch/donna-marsh....

At:  http://www.videorolls.com/watch/donna-marsh...  she begs our members to use "reasonable arguments," and "just go out into the world and ask the fundamental questions of that day."

At: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-CrlDr-IEAA  she begs the media to do their job.

While we do not expect media employees to disregard the requirements of their employers, we suggest that others are under no obligation to ignore obvious facts. Some of these obvious facts are on display in the short video "The Official Account of the Twin Towers," which you are invited to see and share at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OASbBr99heQ .

Law Enforcement Officers have taken an oath to defend the Constitution, and so are under an obligation NOT to ignore obvious facts. If any are reading this, we suggest you also view: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=16SQJz-wnQg .

Employees of the Department of Homeland Security are invited to view: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mlwgZzeq8oI , and the related videos on that YouTube page.

Underlying the reluctance to look at such facts is the possibility that the government of the United States may have told its citizens a lie. That more general distrust of government is frequently called "conspiracy theory"  by the mass media, and is sometimes characterized as a sort of mental illness. Regarding this matter, one may consider the statements of government psychiatrist Steve Pieczenik, M.D., Ph.D., at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vicwIrB9JFw , and those of a panoply of psychologists and psychotherapists at http://consciouslifenews.com/psychologists-explain-911-denial-despite-hard-scientific-evidence/1122104/ . 

Popular writer Jonah Berger's book, Invisible Influence, begins its opening chapter, "Monkey See, Monkey Do," by expounding the findings of Muzafer Sherif and Solomon Asch.

"To test whether people conformed because the answer was uncertain, Asch devised a different experiment. Rather than putting people in a situation where the answer was unclear, he wanted to see what they would do when the answer was obvious. When people could easily tell the correct answer right away and thus would have no need to rely on others. The line-length task was a perfect choice. Even those with poor eyesight could tell the correct answer. They might have to squint a little, but it was right there in front of them. There was no need to rely on anyone else. Asch thought that when the answer was clear, conformity could be reduced drastically. To provide an even stronger test, Asch rigged the group's responses . . .

"Asch used the line task because he assumed it would reduce conformity. Real participants could see the right answer, so it shouldn't matter that others gave the wrong response. People should act independently and go with what they saw. Maybe a couple participants would waver once in a while, but for the most part people should give the right answer.

"They didn't.

"Not even close.

"Conformity was rampant. Around 75 percent of participants conformed to the group at least once. And while most people didn't conform on every trial, on average, people conformed a third of the time. 

"Even though people's own eyes told them the correct answer, they went along with the group. Even when they could clearly tell that the group was incorrect."

The video 9/11: A Conspiracy Theory, made by the independent journalist James Corbett, expresses another response to such characterization, and is available at: http://www.corbettreport.com/911-a-conspira....

There is a Fifties-vintage song by "Osama & the Bin Ladens" (which in my opinion is excellent) entitled, It's All A Lie (Still You Believe) at:   http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vjKUs65beKg .

At the website http://9-11.meetup.com/ you will find a map indicating Meetup groups around the world covering the topic of 9/11. Note that these are only Meetup groups, and as such do not represent all the groups which are concerned with 9/11. There are no regulations pertaining to membership in Meetup groups, and anyone anywhere in the world is invited to join this group in order to participate in it to whatever extent is possible for them. Persons outside the U.S.A. may be able to provide valuable services not possible for those inside it. If nothing else, they can provide useful information pertaining to their locations. An international calendar of 9/11 events is at http://www.911truth.o...

We meet occasionally at various locations.

The group has assumed the form standard for most political activism groups: main body of members, and a smaller, self-constituted body, often called a "steering group" or "steering committee." 

It should be noted that although Meetup automatically assumes that all and only the people who RSVP YES show up, and not anyone else, this is frequently not the case, so the attendance figures which Meetup automatically posts are frequently not accurate, and comments on and reviews of the meetings are frequently neglected---by everyone involved. This is not advocated, but it is a fact. Don't assume a meeting was small or that nothing happened just because Meetup's tally and comments seem to indicate that. We're often more interested in doing than in telling what we've done, and we just have too many events to be much concerned about rating them.

In addition to talking in person, we have recently opened a 9/11 map on DebateGraph, in which we invite you (i.e., everyone) to participate. Go to: http://debategraph.or... and click on the tiny "Debategraph" tab on the bottom left to begin to use this new tool.


Please be sure to enable the site to send you emails.

Contact:
Donald Stahl
politicstahl@hotmail.com.
meetup_8_name: The St. Louis 9/11 Questions Meetup Group

meetup_0_description:
Here is your chance to move the water cooler at work out amongst the rest of the world. This multi-partisan group will talk about everything from politics to religion to race; the things that you aren't supposed to talk about in public. 

We are about the sharing of ideas and points of view. Points of view which will likely be different from views you currently hold. The goal is not to solve anything, but to leave the Meetup with a better understanding of how someone who hold beliefs completely opposite from you can come to their conclusions. This requires disagreement, but respect for other people and the acknowledgement that they are completely entitled to the views they hold. 

So bring your brain and your passion, but leave your anger and condescension at home. It is encouraged that we all leave as friends, but required that we don't leave as enemies. For this group to succeed, it is important that we have a diverse group of people from conservatives to liberals; from believers to non believers, etc. We need different nationalities, ethnicities and religions that come from all walks of life.

Caution: If you are a hothead, this is not the group for you. You won't enjoy the Meetup and neither will we. Besides, there are plenty of what I call "Lovefest groups" out there that are willing support your already held beliefs. This is a "Learnfest!" So come test your views on politics, heaven and hell, the best positions for making love, affirmative action, etc...what you learn should and could be fun!
meetup_0_name: The Issues You Don't Talk About Cafe
meetup_0_next_event_name: The Issues You Don't Talk About Cafe Mid-Month Meetup
meetup_0_organizer_bio: One of the fondest memories of my high school youth was drama class.  I don't remember doing much drama, but we did do a lot of improvisation and games.  I'd like to revisit those days to see where it goes.  Maybe a new acting company will be born.
meetup_1_description: This is a group for anyone who wants to really understand if their is any truth to "Conspiracy Theories, UFO phenomena, Government cover ups, Globalist Agenda, Chem Trails...etc... etc..." If you watch or listen to David Wilcox, Corey Goode, Gaia TV, Ancient Aliens, Alex Jones, David Ike, Believe Snowden and Julian Assange are Hero's. Wiki Leaks are important and true and also believe we need to have full DISCLOSURE. This is a group to make friends, socialize and share information without being looked at like you are crazy! A safe place where you can talk with others who are awake. To get a glimpse of what we are about watch the movie "Thrive" on Utube.
meetup_1_next_event_name: Cryptocurrency:  Liberation, or a way for elite powers to gain control?
meetup_2_description:
Concerned about where the country is heading? You're not alone. Join others who care about what's happening to democracy, equality, human rights, social justice, sustainability, and other important topics. It's ok if you've never been to a protest, march, or town hall -- start here. You really can make a difference.

WHAT YOU CAN DO
- Join this group now
- Schedule one of our Meetup ideas in your neighborhood
- Discuss your own Meetup ideas in the group conversation

OUR COMMUNITY GUIDELINES
- Be Peaceful
- Be Safe
- Be Kind
- Be Respectful
- Be Real
meetup_2_organizer_bio:
We're #Resist Coordinators, here to empower you with more info, resources, and guidance to lead your local #Resist.

#Resist brings people together to act in their neighborhoods on the values essential to democracy. We show up, and keep showing up.
meetup_3_description:
This site offers factual information and viewpoints that might be useful in arriving at an understanding of the events of our time. We believe that the information comes from reliable sources, but cannot guarantee the information to be free of mistakes and incorrect interpretations. 

Please be sure to enable the site to send you emails.

To see unobstructed tiles, click on Sponsors and scroll down.

Introductory Video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8HZdgaViIyI.

Theme songs: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hvQOA0fznrA  (The Visitors).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jDJpf2mQ0w4  (Faster).

We are residents of the Greater St. Louis Area (and other areas throughout the world) concerned about the many disturbing aspects of the 9/11 attacks and interested in finding out more about those events. We share the St. Louis Fusion Center's dedication to ". . . the collection, analysis and dissemination of information used to detect, defend against, or respond to acts of terrorism." We have many disagreements, but we agree that 9/11 is worth inquiring into. We are inclusive as opposed to exclusive. Generally, we believe that when an object moves under the influence of gravity, the object goes down, not upwards and outwards in an arc, as objects did when the Towers "fell."

James Ridgeway says:

". . . not one person in the White House—or in the cabinet, or the Pentagon, or anywhere in the Bush administration—was fired because of failure to perform on 9/11. Not one person resigned. With the exception of Richard Clarke, not one person apologized to the victims' families. Nearly twenty-eight hundred people died, and not one of the people responsible for protecting them was held accountable." (The Five Unanswered Questions about 9/11, p. 88.)

And, several were handsomely rewarded.


Regarding the murder of the Russian journalist Anna Politkovskaya, who was critical of Vladimir Putin, Reporters Without Borders states:

"Novaya Gazeta editor Dmitry Muratov said there was still a 'political taboo' about the real mastermind’s identity. 'Six years have gone by – it is time to ask difficult questions,' he said."

Fifteen years have gone by since September 11, 2001. Here in the United States, we too say: "It is time to ask difficult questions."

meetup_3_name: The St. Louis 9/11 Questions Meetup Group
meetup_4_description: St. Louis conservatives gather monthly for an evening of camaraderie, sharing of knowledge, and engagement in activities that make a difference.  Part of a national initiative launched by the Heritage Foundation, the nation's leading conservative think tank.
meetup_4_name: The St. Louis Townhall Meetup Group
meetup_5_description:
St. Louis Indivisible is one of several local activist groups following the methods of resistance laid out in the Indivisible Guide.

 Indivisible is a very specific, highly effective action plan written by congressional staffers. The plan is based on the methods the Tea Party used to obstruct Obama for eight years. Our local Indivisible groups are part of a network of groups across the country that are pressuring their Members of Congress to resist the current agenda, and what we're doing works. Come join us!

This Meetup group shares events scheduled by St. Louis Indivisible. If you're on Facebook, you can join them directly below. 

St. Louis Indivisible: A Political Action Salon
meetup_5_organizer_bio: I'm a freelance writer, and I've been living out of a backpack for almost 3 years. I'll be returning to St. Louis in March, and I'm really excited about making a life there, so I'm starting to join groups in advance. Look forward to joining you!
meetup_6_description:
The American Solidarity Party is committed to transcending the Red/Blue divide with coherent policies informed by religious values. We offer the following program for a future based on the principles of Common Good, Common Ground, and Common Sense.

- Right to Life
- Religion in the Public Square
- Civil Rights
- Economic Participation
- Banking & Finance in the Public Interest
- Free and Fair Trade
- Stewardship of the Environment
- Civic Engagement
- Public Services
- Justice in the Workplace
- National Security
meetup_7_description: This is a group to help fellow conservatives grow their businesses through professional networking and fellowship. Meetings will be focused on building a network of like minded referral partners who through the growing of their businesses together help to make each other prosperous. Presenters may include not only our members, but individuals who address issues of importance to our belief in the free market and our professional development.
meetup_8_description: Dennis Prager talk radio listeners gather monthly with other conservatives for an evening of lively discussion and camaraderie.  Dennis is a conservative talk radio host and columnist for Townhall.com.
meetup_8_name: The Missouri Dennis Prager Meetup Group

meetup_0_description:
The Ethical Society of St. Louis is a Welcoming Home for Humanists and their families, an inter-generational community of people dedicated to deed before creed. We are a congregation that focuses on this world and this life--making them better for all people. We have weekly activities for children, teens, and adults interested in meeting like-minded people; in ethical, personal, and intellectual growth; and in social justice. All our activities are open to all.

Our main meeting is Sunday at 11am at 9001 Clayton Road, 63117. For lots more information, see our web site at ethicalstl.org, and/or https://www.facebook.com/EthicalSTL.
meetup_0_organizer_bio: I'm a Londoner by birth, just moving to St. Louis after 7 years in Boston. Finishing my doctorate from Harvard while working at the Ethical Society in Clayton. Central West End resident, choral singer, public speaker, author, podcaster, homosexual ;)

meetup_0_description:
Here is your chance to move the water cooler at work out amongst the rest of the world. This multi-partisan group will talk about everything from politics to religion to race; the things that you aren't supposed to talk about in public. 

We are about the sharing of ideas and points of view. Points of view which will likely be different from views you currently hold. The goal is not to solve anything, but to leave the Meetup with a better understanding of how someone who hold beliefs completely opposite from you can come to their conclusions. This requires disagreement, but respect for other people and the acknowledgement that they are completely entitled to the views they hold. 

So bring your brain and your passion, but leave your anger and condescension at home. It is encouraged that we all leave as friends, but required that we don't leave as enemies. For this group to succeed, it is important that we have a diverse group of people from conservatives to liberals; from believers to non believers, etc. We need different nationalities, ethnicities and religions that come from all walks of life.

Caution: If you are a hothead, this is not the group for you. You won't enjoy the Meetup and neither will we. Besides, there are plenty of what I call "Lovefest groups" out there that are willing support your already held beliefs. This is a "Learnfest!" So come test your views on politics, heaven and hell, the best positions for making love, affirmative action, etc...what you learn should and could be fun!

meetup_2_description:
Concerned about where the country is heading? You're not alone. Join others who care about what's happening to democracy, equality, human rights, social justice, sustainability, and other important topics. It's ok if you've never been to a protest, march, or town hall -- start here. You really can make a difference.

WHAT YOU CAN DO
- Join this group now
- Schedule one of our Meetup ideas in your neighborhood
- Discuss your own Meetup ideas in the group conversation

OUR COMMUNITY GUIDELINES
- Be Peaceful
- Be Safe
- Be Kind

meetup_2_organizer_bio:
We're #Resist Coordinators, here to empower you with more info, resources, and guidance to lead your local #Resist.

#Resist brings people together to act in their neighborhoods on the values essential to democracy. We show up, and keep showing up.
meetup_3_description:
This site offers factual information and viewpoints that might be useful in arriving at an understanding of the events of our time. We believe that the information comes from reliable sources, but cannot guarantee the information to be free of mistakes and incorrect interpretations. 

Please be sure to enable the site to send you emails.

To see unobstructed tiles, click on Sponsors and scroll down.

Introductory Video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8HZdgaViIyI.

Theme songs: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hvQOA0fznrA  (The Visitors).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jDJpf2mQ0w4  (Faster).

We are residents of the Greater St. Louis Area (and other areas throughout the world) concerned about the many disturbing aspects of the 9/11 attacks and interested in finding out more about those events. We share the St. Louis Fusion Center's dedication to ". . . the collection, analysis and dissemination of information used to detect, defend against, or respond to acts of terrorism." We have many disagreements, but we agree that 9/11 is worth inquiring into. We are inclusive as opposed to exclusive. Generally, we believe that when an object moves under the influence of gravity, the object goes down, not upwards and outwards in an arc, as objects did when the Towers "fell."

James Ridgeway says:

". . . not one person in the White House—or in the cabinet, or the Pentagon, or anywhere in the Bush administration—was fired because of failure to perform on 9/11. Not one person resigned. With the exception of Richard Clarke, not one person apologized to the victims' families. Nearly twenty-eight hundred people died, and not one of the people responsible for protecting them was held accountable." (The Five Unanswered Questions about 9/11, p. 88.)

And, several were handsomely rewarded.


Regarding the murder of the Russian journalist Anna Politkovskaya, who was critical of Vladimir Putin, Reporters Without Borders states:

"Novaya Gazeta editor Dmitry Muratov said there was still a 'political taboo' about the real mastermind’s identity. 'Six years have gone by – it is time to ask difficult questions,' he said."

Fifteen years have gone by since September 11, 2001. Here in the United States, we too say: "It is time to ask difficult questions."

ATTEMPTS TO DISCOURAGE INQUIRY

(If you have not read Ibsen's play An Enemy of the People, it is available here: http://www2.hn.psu.edu/faculty/jmanis/h-ibs...  .)

We are aware that the bulk of the mass media are owned by at most six international conglomerates, and that they are united in their efforts to portray any inquiry into the events of 9/11 as somehow harmful or hurtful to the families of the victims of that catastrophe. But it was precisely a group of widowed mothers who first raised questions, and who pressured the government into conducting any investigation whatsoever. In the words of one of them, Patty Casazza, "Likeminded, we all had questions. We all had questions, and we wanted answers."  Their struggle to obtain information from the government is documented in the video 9/11: Press for Truth, at: http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=397... .

Seventy percent of their questions went unanswered by the 9/11 Commission, and are unanswered still.

Survivors have sued for the loss of their loved ones, and not one family member's case has been allowed to go to trial, where rules of evidence would permit questioning in public and under oath, and deponents can be compelled to answer. Widowed 9/11 family member Ellen Mariani  has challenged the official story in the U.S. court system for over a decade; repeated dismissals forced her to appeal unsuccessfully for a hearing by the U.S. Supreme Court. See: http://marianilawsuit.wordpress.com/ .

We are guided by Donna Marsh O'Connor, who lost her pregnant daughter on 9/11.  Her feelings may be seen at: http://www.videorolls.com/watch/donna-marsh....

At:  http://www.videorolls.com/watch/donna-marsh...  she begs our members to use "reasonable arguments," and "just go out into the world and ask the fundamental questions of that day."

At: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-CrlDr-IEAA  she begs the media to do their job.

While we do not expect media employees to disregard the requirements of their employers, we suggest that others are under no obligation to ignore obvious facts. Some of these obvious facts are on display in the short video "The Official Account of the Twin Towers," which you are invited to see and share at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OASbBr99heQ .

Law Enforcement Officers have taken an oath to defend the Constitution, and so are under an obligation NOT to ignore obvious facts. If any are reading this, we suggest you also view: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=16SQJz-wnQg .

Employees of the Department of Homeland Security are invited to view: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mlwgZzeq8oI , and the related videos on that YouTube page.

Underlying the reluctance to look at such facts is the possibility that the government of the United States may have told its citizens a lie. That more general distrust of government is frequently called "conspiracy theory"  by the mass media, and is sometimes characterized as a sort of mental illness. Regarding this matter, one may consider the statements of government psychiatrist Steve Pieczenik, M.D., Ph.D., at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vicwIrB9JFw , and those of a panoply of psychologists and psychotherapists at http://consciouslifenews.com/psychologists-explain-911-denial-despite-hard-scientific-evidence/1122104/ . 

Popular writer Jonah Berger's book, Invisible Influence, begins its opening chapter, "Monkey See, Monkey Do," by expounding the findings of Muzafer Sherif and Solomon Asch.

"To test whether people conformed because the answer was uncertain, Asch devised a different experiment. Rather than putting people in a situation where the answer was unclear, he wanted to see what they would do when the answer was obvious. When people could easily tell the correct answer right away and thus would have no need to rely on others. The line-length task was a perfect choice. Even those with poor eyesight could tell the correct answer. They might have to squint a little, but it was right there in front of them. There was no need to rely on anyone else. Asch thought that when the answer was clear, conformity could be reduced drastically. To provide an even stronger test, Asch rigged the group's responses . . .

"Asch used the line task because he assumed it would reduce conformity. Real participants could see the right answer, so it shouldn't matter that others gave the wrong response. People should act independently and go with what they saw. Maybe a couple participants would waver once in a while, but for the most part people should give the right answer.

"They didn't.

"Not even close.

"Conformity was rampant. Around 75 percent of participants conformed to the group at least once. And while most people didn't conform on every trial, on average, people conformed a third of the time. 

"Even though people's own eyes told them the correct answer, they went along with the group. Even when they could clearly tell that the group was incorrect."

The video 9/11: A Conspiracy Theory, made by the independent journalist James Corbett, expresses another response to such characterization, and is available at: http://www.corbettreport.com/911-a-conspira....

There is a Fifties-vintage song by "Osama & the Bin Ladens" (which in my opinion is excellent) entitled, It's All A Lie (Still You Believe) at:   http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vjKUs65beKg .

At the website http://9-11.meetup.com/ you will find a map indicating Meetup groups around the world covering the topic of 9/11. Note that these are only Meetup groups, and as such do not represent all the groups which are concerned with 9/11. There are no regulations pertaining to membership in Meetup groups, and anyone anywhere in the world is invited to join this group in order to participate in it to whatever extent is possible for them. Persons outside the U.S.A. may be able to provide valuable services not possible for those inside it. If nothing else, they can provide useful information pertaining to their locations. An international calendar of 9/11 events is at http://www.911truth.o...

We meet occasionally at various locations.

The group has assumed the form standard for most political activism groups: main body of members, and a smaller, self-constituted body, often called a "steering group" or "steering committee." 

It should be noted that although Meetup automatically assumes that all and only the people who RSVP YES show up, and not anyone else, this is frequently not the case, so the attendance figures which Meetup automatically posts are frequently not accurate, and comments on and reviews of the meetings are frequently neglected---by everyone involved. This is not advocated, but it is a fact. Don't assume a meeting was small or that nothing happened just because Meetup's tally and comments seem to indicate that. We're often more interested in doing than in telling what we've done, and we just have too many events to be much concerned about rating them.

In addition to talking in person, we have recently opened a 9/11 map on DebateGraph, in which we invite you (i.e., everyone) to participate. Go to: http://debategraph.or... and click on the tiny "Debategraph" tab on the bottom left to begin to use this new tool.


Please be sure to enable the site to send you emails.

Donald Stahl

meetup_5_description:
St. Louis Indivisible is one of several local activist groups following the methods of resistance laid out in the Indivisible Guide.

 Indivisible is a very specific, highly effective action plan written by congressional staffers. The plan is based on the methods the Tea Party used to obstruct Obama for eight years. Our local Indivisible groups are part of a network of groups across the country that are pressuring their Members of Congress to resist the current agenda, and what we're doing works. Come join us!

This Meetup group shares events scheduled by St. Louis Indivisible. If you're on Facebook, you can join them directly below. 

St. Louis Indivisible: A Political Action Salon

This workshop is designed for newcomers, so don't be shy!

Past topics include: the separation of church and state, paternalism, children's rights, libertarianism, and fairness.

Find us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/groups/1477779839205159/

meetup_1_description:
Those interested in other options to the expensive, ludicrous, and constricting WALL between USA and Mexico. Is it not obvious we should consider a UN-Observed bi-lateral popular vote between the USA and Mexico, to consider Mexico as the 51st state!

For U.S. citizens, think of the shackles removed, the freedom to travel freely and buy property in Mexico, were it is warm in the winter, the ease of vacation travel there.  For potential Mexican state U.S. citizens think of the right to participate fully in the best democracy on the planet, bar none; better law, education, medicine, highways, infrastructure, security.  And for Mexicans and Americans alike the disintegration of all the immigration hassles, less court cases on citizenship/green cards and more court cases on drug cartel mobsters.

Less money spent in USA for walls, border patrols, ICE, drug interdiction (and by the way freedom to actively pursue drug cartels with a smaller border police contingent between Belize/Guatemala and the new Mexican state of USA.  Consider: better medicine for Mexico;  more tax dollars for USA, graduated federal and state taxing in 51st state over five years to build taxing infrastructure/administration.

More natural resources for USA, hopefully with the intent to preserve the most resources we can and use as little as possible, wisely. More solar energy development, possibly wind farms where they meet criteria. Migrant labor force from Mexico will remain in USA but can travel back and forth freely, less strain regarding family separation. 

Most of all a turn-around back to true American values.

meetup_0_organizer_bio: I am a retired dentist from St Louis, MO. A longtime Objectivist, I am part of a start-up Community Group dedicated to reading and discussing Ayn Rand's works. We will also plan get-togethers for those interested in meeting like-minded individuals.

meetup_0_description: This Meetup is a "safehouse" designed specifically for those who seek to finally obtain the freedom promised by Dr. Martin Luther King, overcoming those last few remaining chains of slavery: racism, dependency, and the self-defeating and erroneous belief that their progress in some way depends upon the beneficence of White people. The leader of the Meetup is Mason Weaver, a former Black militant and radio call-in show host, and the author of It's OK to Leave the Plantation, Tribalism, and other books. Today, he is an activist, a powerful public speaker, a businessman, and an entrepreneur. He appears regularly on national TV, cable, and news programs.
